definition[0]: all of someone’s property and money, especially everything that is left after they die
example[0]: The property is part of the deceased’s estate.
definition[1]: a large area of land in the country, usually with one large house on it and one owner
definition[2]: an area where houses or buildings of a similar type have all been built together in a planned way
definition[3]: a large piece of land in the country, usually with one large house on it and one owner
example[2]: The estate consists of the main villa, several outbuildings and barns, a swimming pool, a farm house and an old mill.
definition[4]: land used for growing a particular crop, especially tea, coffee, or rubber
definition[5]: an area of land with factories and offices
definition[6]: when someone owns all or part of a piece of land, and any buildings on it, or has a right to use it
definition[7]: all of someone’s money and property, especially everything that is left after they die
example[4]: In her original will, she left her whole estate to her only son.
